intro: Dialiopsis africana, commonly known as the African dialiopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
